notes.text:
An update for thunderbird is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Thunderbird is a standalone mail and newsgroup client.

This update upgrades Thunderbird to version 78.3.1.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 81 and Firefox ESR 78.3 (CVE-2020-15673)

* Mozilla: XSS when pasting attacker-controlled data into a contenteditable element (CVE-2020-15676)

* Mozilla: Download origin spoofing via redirect (CVE-2020-15677)

* Mozilla: When recursing through layers while scrolling, an iterator may have become invalid, resulting in a potential use-after-free scenario (CVE-2020-15678)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Mozilla developer reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 80 and Firefox ESR 78.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 81 and Firefox ESR 78.3
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 81 and Firefox ESR 78.3

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Firefox sometimes ran the onload handler for SVG elements that the DOM sanitizer decided to remove, resulting in JavaScript being executed after pasting attacker-controlled data into a contenteditable element.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: XSS when pasting attacker-controlled data into a contenteditable element

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: XSS when pasting attacker-controlled data into a contenteditable element

cwe.name: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

By exploiting an Open Redirect vulnerability on a website, an attacker could have spoofed the site displayed in the download file dialog to show the original site (the one suffering from the open redirect) rather than the site the file was actually downloaded from.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Download origin spoofing via redirect
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Download origin spoofing via redirect

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

When recursing through graphical layers while scrolling, an iterator may have become invalid, resulting in a potential use-after-free. This occurs because the function `APZCTreeManager::ComputeClippedCompositionBounds` did not follow iterator invalidation rules.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: When recursing through layers while scrolling, an iterator may have become invalid, resulting in a potential use-after-free scenario
